creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: autumn scene: small garden with grey pathway and amber-colored plots with small bushes, rocks in foreground; part of white building at R; pond with small waterfall, green bushes, rocks, and red Japanese maple trees in middle ground; orange, red, yellow forest with mountains and rising steam in background
inscription: Left: [一九五四年作　箱根神仙郷　日光殿のお庭] {1954nen saku, ?????}; bottom, in grey: [Autumn in Hakone Museum] [Toshi Yoshida]
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Autumn in Hakone Museum
